questions.question_text: Which statement is true about stopping Node Manager?

choices.E: The administration server goes into ADMIN mode if it can no longer communicate with Node Manager.
choices.A: If you stop Node Manager, the managed servers it started will also stop.
choices.C: Use the stopNodeManager.sh script so Node Manager stops gracefully.
choices.B: You may kill the Node Manager process by using operating system commands.
choices.F: The managed servers that Node Manager started go into ADMIN mode if they can no longer communicate with Node Manager.
choices.D: Using the administration console, select the appropriate machine and click Stop.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B é verdade!
B is true

questions.question_text:
Your domain's security realm has two authentication provides: ldap1 and ldap2.
Consider these requirements:
"¢ If authentication succeeds with ldap1, then skip ldap2.
"¢ If authentication fails with ldap1, then authentication must succeed with ldap2.
Which control flag should you use for ldap1?

discussion.content: https://docs.oracle.com/middleware/12213/wls/SECMG/atn_intro.htm#SECMG699

Maybe the correct answer is E.

Noting that for WEB application in cluster must use ""proxy""

web applications: load balancing is achieved through the cluster proxy.
This proxy can be * proxy plug-in OR * hardware load balancer
E is nosense
Don't think you can have multiple domains in a single cluster, so E
Why not E? Only one cluster is specified so I assume only one domain.

questions.question_text:
You are in the process of planning a deployment in which a single WebLogic cluster will host a web application. There are several options to consider.
Which is not a valid decision?

choices.A: Proxy plug-in or hardware load balancer

choices.C: You can choose to shut down the server right away or after it completes its work.
choices.A: The managed server was running on the same machine as the administration server.
choices.D: The administration console calls WLST to accomplish the shutdown.
choices.B: Node Manager is configured properly and running on the managed server's machine.

discussion.content: You do not need a Nodemanager to be up and running to shutdown a server. It needs to be up only to start the server. So, B is incorrect.
C is correct. Node manager can manage server on other machine
Yes B is certainly correct
B is also correct, isn't it?

questions.question_text:
You shut down a managed server by using the administration console.
Which statement is always true?

A new machine was given to your department. This machine has two WebLogic Server 12.1.2 installations, each with different inventories.

Which command or tool do you run to
determine the differences in products installed in each of the inventories?

choices.A: None, inventories are used by Oracle databases only.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D é o correto!
modify the answer please, the correct one is "D"

Selected Answer: D
Es la D.
it's D,

Answer is D. $ORACLE_HOME/oui/bin. After your Oracle Fusion Middleware product is installed, you can use the compareInventory.sh (on UNIX operating systems) or compareInventory.cmd (on Windows operating systems) script in ORACLE_HOME/oui/bin to compare the contents of any two Oracle home locations. After your Oracle Fusion Middleware product is installed, you can use the viewInventory.sh (on UNIX operating systems) or viewInventory.cmd (on Windows operating systems) script in ORACLE_HOME/oui/bin to view the contents of any Oracle home directory.

According to https://docs.oracle.com/middleware/12211/lcm/OUIRF/GUID-79BA11B5-4856-4731-8336-7A690415262B.htm#OUIRF387 the answer seems to be D,

Can the compareInventory.sh reside in the path mentioned in B?
Answer is D. $ORACLE_HOME/oui/bin
must be D
I think is D
